definitions.definition: a person who has complete power in a country and uses it in a cruel and unfair way

examples.text: The country was ruled by a succession of tyrants.
His boss is a complete tyrant.
The kings of Sparta would not serve under the tyrants of Syracuse.
He was one of the classical tyrants of Ancient Rome.
Many of the naval officers were no more than petty tyrants.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, via Latin from Greek turannos.
